rules: Rule1: Either drug X is approved or a generic version is available for drug X.
Rule2: Provided that regulatory approval is granted for drug X, clinical trials are completed for drug X.
Rule3: Whenever side effects are present in drug X, it is not the case that a breakthrough occurs in technology Y.
Rule4: If market demand exists for drug X, then production is scaled for drug X.
Rule5: Either market demand exists for drug X or side effects are present in drug X.
Rule6: Given that production is scaled for drug X, distribution is ready for drug X.
Rule7: In the event that drug X is banned, drug X is not approved.
Rule8: Should drug X be restricted, then drug X is not approved.
Rule9: If funding is secured for project Alpha, then provided that it is not the case that drug X is banned or restricted, alternative research is conducted on drug X.
Rule10: On the condition that a breakthrough occurs in technology Y, it is not the case that technology Y is patented.
Rule11: A breakthrough occurs in technology Y or a generic version is available for drug X.
Rule12: Provided that expertise is available in skill Z, then if a breakthrough occurs in technology Y, technology Y is patented.
Rule13: Should it not be the case that drug X is banned or restricted, then alternative research is not conducted on drug X.
Rule14: In the event that it is not the case that the absence of drug X being banned or restricted implies alternative research on drug X, regulatory approval is granted for drug X.

Rule15: Provided that it is not the case that the absence of drug X being banned or restricted implies alternative research on drug X, it is not the case that clinical trials are completed for drug X.
facts: Fact1: Funding is secured for project Alpha.
Fact2: Expertise is available in skill Z.
Fact3: It is not the case that distribution is ready for drug X.

question: A generic version is available for drug X.
